item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Arnis: Generate Cities in Minecraft from OpenStreetMap (56 points | 6 comments)
2. The GTA III port for the Dreamcast has been released (207 points | 45 comments)
3. Things we learned about LLMs in 2024 (313 points | 238 comments)
4. Morris Chang and the Origins of TSMC (132 points | 40 comments)
5. Systems ideas that sound good but almost never work (203 points | 138 comments)
6. Deepseek: The quiet giant leading China’s AI race (243 points | 179 comments)
7. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (2016) (287 points | 103 comments)
8. Just Words (YC W24) Is Hiring ( | hide)
9. How to monitor your local weather with Grafana (140 points | 35 comments)
10. Revisiting the NetBSD Build System (11 points | 1 comment)
11. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (563 points | 191 comments)
12. Show HN: Watch 3 AIs compete in real-time stock trading (155 points | 125 comments)
13. More telcos confirm Salt Typhoon breaches as White House weighs in (306 points | 244 comments)
14. Peephole optimizations: adding `opt_respond_to` to the Ruby VM, part 4 (14 points | discuss)
15. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (314 points | 122 comments)
16. Darktable 5.0.0 (258 points | 80 comments)
17. App Should Have Been a Website (and Probably Your Game Too) (158 points | 234 comments)
18. The History of Cholera in Great Britain (1947) (12 points | discuss)
19. AI companies cause most of traffic on forums (484 points | 303 comments)
20. Reciprocal Approximation with 1 Subtraction (81 points | 33 comments)
21. Identifying and Manipulating LLM Personality Traits via Activation Engineering (6 points | discuss)
22. I wrote a Game Boy Advance game in Zig (305 points | 113 comments)
23. Show HN: Handwritten Christmas Card for Hacker News (32 points | 11 comments)
24. Show HN: Onramp Can Compile Doom (54 points | 11 comments)
25. “A Course of Pure Mathematics” – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (278 points | 77 comments)
26. Ruby-refrigerator: Freeze all core Ruby classes (116 points | 37 comments)
27. Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (196 points | 52 comments)
28. Journey from Entrepreneur to Employee (25 points | 8 comments)
29. Dinner for One: British comedy Germans have been laughing at for years (2018) (73 points | 46 comments)
30. What Happens to Relicensed Open Source Projects and Their Forks? (93 points | 27 comments)
